items.title: Ex-Israeli PM Bennett slams Netanyahu office's reported Qatargate cover-up as 'worst treason in country's history'
items.summary: After i24News shared correspondences between Netanyahu aides strategizing on how to promote Qatari messages in Israeli media, Bennet said that 'three of Netanyahu's closest advisors effectively served as paid agents of Qatar and Hamas at the height of the war' – which, according to him, explains Isr

items.title: Dozens of U.S. House Democrats tell Trump Israel's actions in Gaza jeopardizing cease-fire
items.summary: Recognizing that Hamas has violated the truce, the lawmakers warned that the Israeli response has been 'severe and disproportionate,' calling on the Trump administration to exert leverage to stop Israeli attacks in Gaza

items.title: Five Israelis arrested after attack on West Bank Palestinian village leaves mother and three children wounded, two sheep slaughtered
items.summary: Security camera footage from the family's home shows at least six people taking part in the overnight attack. The suspects allegedly pepper-sprayed the mother and her children, beat them, attacked the family's sheep and damaged their property

items.title: U.S. orders $13 million in Colt rifles for Israel despite push for domestic arms production amid embargo concerns
items.summary: Months-long delays in a domestic tender appear to have pushed Israel toward a U.S. purchase that undercuts its effort to shift rifle production to local manufacturers and reduce reliance on imports

items.title: 'A miracle': Officer shot in head during Bondi attack home from hospital
items.summary: The Christmas homecoming of Jack Hibbert, who was shot in the head and shoulder, is a "miracle", his family say.

items.title: Netanyahu is poisoning the Oct. 7 inquiry to dilute his responsibility for the catastrophe
items.summary: As early as October 8 2023, the Israeli prime minister decided that no state commission of inquiry would be allowed to hold him responsible. Now, the prime ministers of the last three decades, hundreds of thousands of protesters and the heads of the legal system will be forced to bear responsibility

items.title: Netanyahu's aides misled the Israeli media for the prime minister and spread Qatari propaganda
items.summary: The ease with which dubious information was shared with reporters – who then shared it with their viewers and readers – raises serious concerns about the integrity of the conduct of senior bodies in Israeli democracy

items.title: 24 wounded in East Jerusalem amid police, IDF raid, Red Crescent says
What Friday's underwhelming Epstein files release means for Trump and Maga
items.summary: Conservative influencers were conspicuously silent following the latest release - but political danger remains for the president.

items.title: If secular, liberal Tel Aviv must have a chief rabbi, it has to be someone who fits the city
Israeli judges and jurists must learn from Poland's experience defending democracy
Kahane may be dead, but his followers are taking over Israeli education and health
Netanyahu's sham probe into October 7 should draw the mass protests he fears most
items.summary: Netanyahu is afraid of huge demonstrations, but they won't erupt by themselves. All the leaders of the opposition must jointly call for protests, together with every public organization and all the ordinary people who have opted for despair

items.title: Israel extends order allowing closure of foreign media outlets - even without state of emergency
items.summary: The bill replaces temporary emergency legislation, which was originally passed to authorize the shutdown of the Qatar-based network in Israel. The new law does not require court approval to close a media outlet

items.title: Jerusalem authorities raze illegally constructed Silwan building that was home to 13 Palestinian families
items.summary: Residents say they were forced to leave the house in haste and were not given time to collect their belongings. A demolition order was issued for the structure in 2025 since it was built without permission – and residents have tried in vain to obtain a permit ever since

items.title: ADL accuses Mamdani transition members of engaging in 'antisemitic, anti-Zionist' activities
items.summary: Zohran Mamdani, who will be sworn in as New York City mayor on January 1, slammed the ADL report, saying it diverts attention from actual antisemitism and that a distinction must be made between Jew hatred and criticism of the Israeli government, which the ADL 'oftentimes ignores'

items.title: Ros Atkins on… the oil tanker being pursued by the US
items.summary: The BBC’s Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at what we know about the "active pursuit" of an oil tanker by the US Coast Guard off the coast of Venezuela.

items.title: 'Why choose this fight?' How the daughter of a Korean-Buddhist became one of America's most distinguished rabbis
items.summary: In a new memoir, Rabbi Angela Buchdahl traces her journey from a young immigrant whose Jewishness was often challenged, to the rabbi called on to lead Hanukkah at the White House. Last month, she called out Zohran Mamdani for 'mainstreaming some of the most abhorrent antisemitism'

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
Fierce Trump critic George Conway to run in crowded New York Democratic congressional primary
items.summary: Conway, a former Republican, will run as a Democrat in the primary to replace retiring U.S. Rep. Jerry Nadler in what is considered the nation's most Jewish district. He has been critical of Israel and of the Biden administration's actions in the Gaza war

items.title: 13% of Republicans attending Turning Point USA deem Israel 'not a U.S. ally'
items.summary: 'Israel is an important ally, and there are things we'll certainly work on together,' Vice President JD Vance said at a conference of the movement once led by the slain Charlie Kirk, 'but we're also going to have very substantive disagreements with Israel, and that's OK'

items.title: The poison of Israel's Jewish extremists is seeping out of the West Bank
items.summary: Israelis have largely ignored a surge in settler violence in the West Bank, but as it reaches Israeli cities, they'd do well to ensure it doesn't destroy the country from within

items.title: Israel Police arrest man dressed as Santa Claus at Haifa Christmas festival
items.summary: Police were seen interrupting a traditional Palestinian dabke dance in a predominantly Arab neighborhood of Haifa, before dispersing the celebrations, confiscating equipment and arresting three men, one of whom was dressed as Santa Claus

items.title: From Bondi Beach to Africa and back to Syria: Where are Islamic State hotspots today?
items.summary: The recent massacre in Sydney and U.S. strikes in Syria raise the question of whether the Islamic State is resurging or has shifted to a low-level global model driven by ideology and technology. 'While not everybody is inspired by slaughter,' one expert warns, IS targets the small number of people w

items.title: No longer the butt of jokes: New museum in Haifa celebrates prim and proper Yekke culture
items.summary: Opening Monday on the University of Haifa campus, the German-Speaking Jewry Heritage Wing of the Hecht Museum houses a collection of art and artifacts donated by descendants of immigrants who fled the Nazis. The exhibit includes a replica of a bare-bones hut inhabited by immigrants to Nahariya

items.title: Culture minister targets funding for Israel's film industry, branding it 'extremist leftist'
items.summary: The law allocates $40.6 million a year in grants to Israel's film industry. Culture Minister Miki Zohar's move followed the Ophir Awards – Israel's equivalent of the Oscars – where The Sea, about a West Bank Palestinian boy, won best film. Zohar has since launched a rival state film award, but six n

items.title: Trump's appointment of Greenland envoy sparks fresh row with Denmark
items.summary: The BBC's diplomatic correspondent James Landale explains how Trump's appoinment of a special envoy to Greenland has shaken diplomatic with Denmark.

items.title: 'Why beat Hezbollah if you can't save our home?': Northern Israelis protest postwar plight
items.summary: Demonstrators shut down most businesses in Kiryat Shmona on Monday morning, including two shopping malls, burned tires and blocked access to nearby communities. 'This place will turn into a giant old-age home,' one protester warned, a year after a cease-fire between Israel and Lebanon

items.title: Far-right Smotrich says Netanyahu pressed him to legalize more West Bank settler outposts
items.summary: Smotrich claims Israeli settlements in the southern West Bank are required to prevent 'a Palestinian invasion' of Israel. On Sunday, the Netanyahu government finalized the legalization of 19 previously unauthorized settler outposts in the West Bank

items.title: Netanyahu: Gov't-backed Oct. 7 inquiry to probe Oslo Accords, anti–judicial coup protests
items.summary: Netanyahu made the remarks at the first meeting of a ministerial committee formed to determine the powers of a politicized probe set to be sent to the Knesset for approval. Other ministers called for the inquiry to examine the Supreme Court's role and the 2005 Gaza disengagement

items.title: Selfies at Auschwitz: main character energy or bearing witness?
items.summary: Posting a smiling selfie from a death camp is generally frowned upon. But as the survivor population shrinks, Prof. Jackie Feldman asks: Could sharing selfies be how a phone-obsessed society witnesses the Holocaust?

items.title: God's chariot and secrets in stone: Top biblical archaeology stories of 2025

items.summary: The U.S. ambassador to Israel also said that, if the Europeans have not yet grasped that a nuclear Iran presents a threat to them as well, 'then they're even dumber than I sometimes think they are'

items.title: Australian Jewish sports club renames mascot in honor of 10-year-old killed in Bondi Beach massacre
items.summary: Melbourne's Maccabi FC Caulfield announced that their 'MaccaBee' mascot will now be known as Matilda, after the parents of the youngest victim of the mass shooting urged the public to 'remember her name'

items.title: Failed homemade bombs, months of planning: Australian police reveals new findings in Bondi massacre
items.summary: Police say the alleged gunmen had planned the attack for several months, training with firearms in isolated rural parts of Australia. The Sydney Morning Herald said one of the perpetrators reportedly traveled to an area in the Philippines known to have connections to ISIS-inspired terrorist organiza

items.title: Bereaved families protest Netanyahu-led probe into Oct. 7 massacre outside PM's office
items.summary: Three protesters were arrested outside the Prime Minister's Office calling for a state commission of inquiry, ahead of the Knesset's first vote on Wednesday.

items.title: U.K. Holocaust charity faces pushback for sacking staffer involved in Standing Together
items.summary: Melanie Goldberg, who had been in the midst of organizing an event at the Scottish parliament, was told that her contract was terminated because the Jewish-Arab movement used the term 'genocide' to describe Israel's actions in Gaza

items.title: Over 70 percent of Israeli Jews oppose Arab parties in government, survey finds
items.summary: Alongside a decline in public trust in Israeli democracy, the report also reveals a drop in confidence in state institutions among all respondents. Meanwhile, the attorney general enjoys the trust of less than 40 percent of both Jewish and Arab respondents

items.title: Could Umm Kulthum have been a lesbian? New film reignites long-suppressed debate
items.summary: The release of a new film has reopened taboo questions about the private life of Egypt's most revered cultural icon, and the limits of what can be said about her

items.title: Netanyahu government unanimously votes to shutter Army Radio by March 1
items.summary: Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara said before the cabinet's approval that Defense Minister Israel Katz's bill cannot be advanced, with her deputies calling the move to close the popular radio station a 'profound and significant infringement on freedom of speech'

items.title: Greek and Cypriot leaders visit Israel to discuss regional cooperation with Netanyahu
items.summary: This is the leaders' first joint meeting since the outbreak of the Gaza war. According to a Greek news report, the three countries are initiating a joint military force against the backdrop of what an Israeli diplomatic source called Turkey's unconstructive role in the Middle East

items.title: Reading like it's 1949: Two books from Israel's establishment that are just as relevant today
items.summary: Which books did Israelis read in the years after the War of Independence? Nearly eight decades later, literature that emerged during the birth of the country – like the two books below – remain shockingly relevant for a society navigating the current postwar era

items.title: There's no such thing as settler violence. It's Israeli violence
items.summary: The violence against Palestinians is the implementation of a long-established policy of ethnic cleansing that doesn't begin and end with 'extremist settlers' or Israel's 'far-right government'

items.title: Israeli government approves politicized Oct. 7 probe, advances batch of judicial coup bills
items.summary: The Likud-backed bill would give the Netanyahu government influence over the composition and mandate of the inquiry into Hamas' October 7 attack. The coalition is also advancing its judicial overhaul in a series of bills affecting the Justice Ministry and police oversight and related areas

items.title: Netanyahu ally met Qatargate suspect Srulik Einhorn at Israel's D.C. embassy
items.summary: Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana confirmed the two met at a conference hosted by the Jerusalem Post, whose editor-in-chief Zvika Klein was previously investigated in the case. Last week's meeting was the first time Einhorn met with a figure close to the prime minister since the Qatargate affair broke out

items.title: Netanyahu: Israel 'aware' of Iranian military exercises, 'making necessary preparations'
Trump once declared ISIS defeated. Now the U.S. is attacking it again in Syria
items.summary: The American strike on dozens of Islamic State targets on Saturday was an impressive display of power, but it falls well short of seriously challenging the organization. Defeating it will require an effective Syrian army – something that does not yet exist

items.title: Giving the Israeli public the middle finger
items.summary: The committee to oversee a coalition-controlled October 7 investigative committee, which will meet on Monday at the time scheduled for a hearing in Netanyahu's corruption trial, signals a government that actively mocks the Israeli state and its citizens

items.summary: Despite appearing stressed, the detective called to testify on behalf of the PM maintained he stuck to the facts, denying any anomalies or conclusions in his report on a notorious 2015 campaign video. items.title: Jewelry of a Nazi concentration camp survivor returned to son in Israel after 80 years
items.summary: The items, preserved because his father was arrested under a false Polish identity, were returned to the man by the head of the Archives' department, an Israeli from the same city as the man. items.title: Israel's record homicide rate isn't just a government failure, it signals Arab society's collapse
items.summary: The Arab society in Israel is a sick society, in which crime lords become idolized figures, and elected municipal representatives live under constant threat. It is a society that cannot endure for much longer

items.title: Israel is becoming a role model to the fascist madmen of the world
items.summary: The far-right's admiration for the Netanyahu regime's blatant disregard for human rights and international norms eclipses the fascists' dislike of Jews

items.title: Hundreds gather in Tel Aviv for Hanukkah ceremony to honor last remaining deceased hostage Ran Gvili
items.summary: Ran Gvili, who was killed fighting Hamas infiltrators on October 7, and his body was abducted to Gaza, has yet to be returned to Israel, and his relatives and other hostage families are fighting against the pressure to move on to the next stage of the cease-fire

items.title: The real useful idiots are those who don't dare criticize Haredi abuse of Israel's democracy
items.summary: Religious Zionist lawmakers pander to Haredi politicians, letting them trample on the rule of law and the foundational concept of a shared, public and universal draft

items.summary: In the early hours of June 13, Israeli missiles slammed into apartment buildings across the Iranian capital, Tehran.  By morning, it became apparent that nine men Israel said were closely associated with the country’s nuclear programme were dead.  Videos posted to social media showed build

items.title: How Russia’s Invasion is Impacting Ukraine’s Youth
items.summary: Last month, in the dead of a cold Autumn night, residents in the Ukrainian town of Balakliia were woken by the sound of two massive explosions. Social media footage showed apartments ablaze, balconies obliterated and a deep crater smouldering in a parking lot. Three people were killed and 13 injured
